pytket._transform¶

Python API module for interfacing with \(\mathrm{t|ket}\rangle\) c++ implemented functions and modules. Exports class Transform

class pytket._transform.Transform¶

An in-place transformation of a Circuit.

CommuteRzRxThroughCX() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Applies a collection of commutation rules to move single qubit rotations (Z/S/Sdg/T/Tdg/Rz/U1/X/V/Vdg/Rx) through the corresponding port of a CX gate towards the front of the circuit.

DecomposeCCX() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Decomposes all 3-qubit Toffoli (CCX) gates into Clifford+T

DecomposeControlledRys() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Decomposes all arbitrarily-quantum-controlled Rys into CX and Ry gates

KAKDecomposition() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Identifies two-qubit subcircuits with more than 3 CXs and reduces them via the KAK/Cartan decomposition, using the method detailed in arxiv:cond-mat/0609750. The replacement subcircuits use CX/U3/S/Sdg/Rz/Ry gates.

OptimiseCliffords() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

An optimisation pass that performs a number of rewrite rules for simplifying Clifford gate sequences, similar to Duncan & Fagan (arxiv:1901.09476). Given a circuit with CXs and any single-qubit gates, produces a circuit with Z/X/S/V/U1/U2/U3/CX gates. This will not preserve CX placement or orientation.

OptimiseCliffordsZX() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Given an entirely Clifford circuit, attempts to optimise the circuit by converting to and from a ZX Diagram (see arxiv:1902.03178 and arxiv:1904.04735)

OptimisePauliGadgets() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

An optimisation pass that identifies the Pauli gadgets corresponding to any non-Clifford rotations and synthesises them pairwise (see Cowtan, Duncan, Dilkes, Simmons, & Sivarajah arxiv:1906.01734). Results use Z/X/S/V/U1/U2/U3/CX gates.

OptimisePhaseGadgets() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

An optimisation pass that starts by identifying subcircuits corresponding to phase gadgets (see Cowtan, Duncan, Dilkes, Simmons, & Sivarajah arxiv:1906.01734) and resynthesises them in a balanced-tree form, followed by applying OptimisePostRouting. Results use U1/U2/U3/CX gates. This will not preserve CX placement or orientation.

OptimisePostRouting() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Fast optimisation pass, performing basic simplifications. Works on any circuit, giving the result in U1/U2/U3/CX gates. If all multi-qubit gates are CXs, then this preserves their placement and orientation, so it is safe to perform after routing.

RebaseToCirq() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase from any gate set into PhasedX, Rz, CZ

RebaseToCliffordSingles() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Identify Clifford-angle rotations (from U1/U2/U3/Rx/Ry/Rz), replacing them with Z/X/S/V gates. Any non-Clifford rotations will stay as they are.

RebaseToProjectQ() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase from any gate set into the allowed ProjectQ gates

RebaseToPyZX() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase from any gate set into the allowed PyZX basic gates

RebaseToQiskit() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase from any gate set into U1/U2/U3/CX.

RebaseToQuil() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase from any gate set into Rx, Rz, CZ

RebaseToRzRx() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Rebase single qubit gates into Rz/Rx.

ReduceSingles() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Reduces any sequence of single qubit rotations into a single U1/U3 gate.

RemoveRedundancies() → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Applies a collection of simple optimisations, such as removing gate-inverse pairs, merging similar rotation gates, and removing identity gates. Preserves the gate set and any placement/orientation of multi-qubit gates.

apply(*args, **kwargs)¶

Overloaded function.

  1. apply(self: pytket._transform.Transform, circuit: pytket._circuit.Circuit) -> bool

Performs the transformation on the circuit in place.

Parameters:circuit – The circuit to be transformed
Returns:Whether any changes were successfully made
  1. apply(self: pytket._transform.Transform, circuit: pytket._routing.PhysicalCircuit) -> bool

Performs the transformation on the circuit in place.

Parameters:circuit – The circuit to be transformed
Returns:Whether any changes were successfully made
repeat(transform: pytket._transform.Transform) → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Applies a given Transform repeatedly to a circuit until no further changes are made (i.e. it no longer returns True). This will return True if at least one run returned True.

Parameters:transform – The Transform to be applied repeatedly
Returns:A new Transform representing the iteration
sequence(transforms: List[pytket._transform.Transform]) → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Composes a list of Transforms together in sequence. The apply method will return True if ANY of the individual Transforms returned True.

Parameters:transforms – The list of Transforms to be composed
Returns:The combined Transform
while_repeat(condition: pytket._transform.Transform, body: pytket._transform.Transform) → pytket._transform.Transform¶

Repeatedly applies the condition Transform until it returns False, running body in between each condition application. Intuitively, this corresponds to WHILE condition DO body

Parameters:
  • condition – The Transform to be applied repeatedly as the condition of a loop
  • body – The Transform to be applied after each successful test of the condition
Returns:

A new Transform representing the iteration
